arm_group.description: Patients with malignant ureteral obstruction have cSEMS(Covered self-expandable dual-layered metal stent) implant

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate Efficacy and Safety of a covered self-expandable
      dual-layered metallic mesh stent (UVENTA) in ureteral obstruction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of a Covered Self-expandable Dual-layered Metallic Mesh Stent (UVENTA) in Ureteral Obstruction

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective, Multi-center, open label, single arm Study

        1. Treatment

           - Covered self-expandable dual-layered metallic mesh Stents(cSEMS) are implanted in
           patents with malignant ureteral obstruction

        2. Follow up

             -  Assessments including X-ray(KUB), are done 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months after the
                procedure.

             -  Diuretic RI scan (DTPA, MAG-3) 3, 6, 12 months after the procedure

             -  Imaging such as IVP(Intravenous Pyelogram), ultrasonogram, CT(Computed Tomogram)
                are performed at 6 and 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients who voluntarily agree to participation and submitted a written informed
             consent for this study, and 20~80 years

          2. One out of following cases below apply to Patients who have malignant ureteral
             obstruction or have benign ureteral obstruction without improvement after previous
             treatment

               -  Patients who doesn't want to have regular replacement of plastic stent

               -  Patients who has no improvement of obstruction after plastic stent implant

               -  Patients who want other Urinary diversion because of stimulatory sign or pain
                  due to plastic stent

          3. Patients with no previous ureteral metal stenting procedure experience.

          4. Patients with more than 6 months of life expectancy

          5. Patients understanding the objective of the study and who are willing to sign a
             consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients with Urothelial Carcinoma

          2. Patients with bladder invasion of malignant tumor

          3. Patients with bladder dysfunction or obstruction of lower urinary tract

          4. one or more times Recurrent Urinary stone in the last 3 years

          5. 2 or more times upper urinary tract infection without upper urinary tract obstruction

          6. Karnofsky scores < 60

          7. Patients with Bacteriuria

          8. Inadequate Patient to participate in the study as judged by the investigator

intervention.intervention_name: cSEMS(Covered self-expandable dual-layered metal stent) implant

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of a Covered Self-expandable Dual-layered Metallic Mesh Stent (UVENTA™) in Ureteral Obstruction: Prospective, Multi-center, Open Label Study

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Urology, Samsung Medical Center, Sungkyunkwan University School of Medicine
Department of Urology, Asan Medical Center

primary_outcome.description: Rate of Ureter units maintaining patency without interventions after technical success of the primary procedure(Diuretic RI scan: T½ < 20 min)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Rate of technical success(each Ureter) resolving the stenosis and passing the contrast medium from the kidney to urinary bladder
Rate of Ureter units maintaining patency without interventions aside from re-stenting(investigational device) after technical success of the primary procedure(Diuretic RI scan: T½ < 20 min)
Rate of total Adverse Events and Adverse Events relevant to Investigational Device
Age, Sex, type of tumor(benign/malignant), length of stenosis, location of stenosis, UVJ cross, balloon catheterization, etc.
secondary_outcome.measure: Predictive Risk Factors for Primary patency rate

secondary_outcome.description: difference of the primary patency between the group of Distal stent located in urinary bladder and ureter
secondary_outcome.measure: the primary patency rate among different location of distal stent

secondary_outcome.description: Comparative analysis of USSQ : before procedure and after procedure

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
